thread.title: Collingwood defender Ben Sinclair suffers hamstring injury against Essendon in JLT Community Series
thread.title_full: Collingwood defender Ben Sinclair suffers hamstring injury against Essendon in JLT Community Series

title: Collingwood defender Ben Sinclair suffers hamstring injury against Essendon in JLT Community Series
text:
AFTER a horror run with injuries in 2016, Ben Sinclair was due for some luck this season. 
But his 2017 has picked up right where it left off last season: with injury. 
The 25-year-old Magpie left the field in distress against the Bombers in the third quarter of the opening clash of the JLT Community Series, clutching his hamstring. 
While four concussions ruled Sinclair out of nine games in 2016 — including the last five of the year — hamstring issues have plagued his career. 
In 2015, Sinclair only played six senior matches because of hamstring injuries, while 2014 was much the same, with Sinclair limited to only five matches. 
Despite debuting in 2011, the small defender only has 63 games to his name. 
More to come ...
